meanings.definition: A person who mends or repairs clothing by sewing up holes.
meanings.sent1: My grandmother is a skilled darner who can fix any hole in our clothes.
meanings.sent2: The darner at the tailor shop repaired my torn shirt beautifully.
meanings.sent3: The darner's needle danced across the fabric, weaving magic to mend the hole.
meanings.sent4: She was a darner of hearts, stitching together broken relationships with care.
meanings.sent5: The darner's hands worked like magic, bringing life back to the torn garment.

meanings.definition: A tool used for sewing up holes in fabric.
meanings.sent1: I used the darner to fix the hole in my favorite sweater.
meanings.sent2: The darner in my sewing kit is essential for repairing torn clothes.
meanings.sent3: The darner lay quietly in the sewing box, waiting to mend any tear.
meanings.sent4: The darner gleamed in the sunlight, ready to work its magic on the fabric.
meanings.sent5: With the darner in hand, I set out to mend the worn-out jeans.

meanings.definition: To mend or repair clothing by sewing up holes.

meanings.sent2: She darnered the torn dress skillfully, saving it from being thrown away.
meanings.sent3: He darnered his ripped jeans in a hurry, hoping no one would notice.
meanings.sent4: The tailor darnered the torn coat with precision, making it look good as new.
meanings.sent5: Darning the hole in the shirt felt like bringing it back to life with each stitch.
